Package heap

Interface IHeap<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of objects held in the Heap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Heap
    public interface IHeap<T>
    Interface used to implement a Heap of type T
    Author:
    William Kelly

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      T delete​(T t)
      Deletes an element from the heap
      int getSize()
      Returns the number of elements in the heap
      void heapify​(int index, int size)
      Function that corrects a single violation of the heap property in a subtree's root, this function has the time complexity of O(lg n)
      void heapSort()
      Produces a heap from an unordered array, then traverses through the heap using heapify to correct violations of the heap property This function has the time complexity of O(nlg n)
      void insert​(T t)
      Inserts an element into the heap
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the heap is empty
      T peek()
      Gets the first object on the heap without modifying the heap

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        void insert​(T t)
        Inserts an element into the heap
        Parameters:
        t - - Element to be inserted into the heap

      • delete

        T delete​(T t)
        Deletes an element from the heap
        Parameters:
        t - - Element to be deleted from the heap
        Returns:
        The object that was deleted

      • peek

        T peek()
        Gets the first object on the heap without modifying the heap
        Returns:
        First object on the heap

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the heap is empty
        Returns:
        true if the heap has no elements

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Returns the number of elements in the heap
        Returns:
        number of elements

      • heapify

        void heapify​(int index,
             int size)
        Function that corrects a single violation of the heap property in a subtree's root, this function has the time complexity of O(lg n)
        Parameters:
        index - The index that heapify starts
        size - The size of the heap

      • heapSort

        void heapSort()
        Produces a heap from an unordered array, then traverses through the heap using heapify to correct violations of the heap property This function has the time complexity of O(nlg n)
